name: Giulio Vivanti
content:
Giulio Benedetto Isacco Vivanti (24 May 1859 – 19 November 1949) was an Italian mathematician. He was a mentor of Bruno de Finetti and he spent most of his academic career at the University of Pavia and University of Milan.
 
 This article about an Italian mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
raw:
Giulio VivantiBorn(1859-05-24)24 May 1859Mantua, ItalyDied19 November 1949(1949-11-19) (aged 90)Milan, ItalyNationalityItalianAlma materUniversity of BolognaUniversity of TurinScientific careerFieldsMathematicsInstitutionsUniversity of Milan

Giulio Benedetto Isacco Vivanti (24 May 1859 – 19 November 1949) was an Italian mathematician. He was a mentor of Bruno de Finetti and he spent most of his academic career at the University of Pavia and University of Milan.

See also[edit]
Vivanti–Pringsheim theorem
References[edit]
Janovitz, Alessandro; Mercanti, Fabio. "Sull'apporto Evolutivo Dei Matematici Ebrei Mantovani Nella Nascente Nazione Italiana" (PDF) (in Italian). Archived from the original (PDF) on 2013-06-27. Retrieved 2012-01-09.
